statement.title: # Content
statement.content:
Consider nine clocks arranged in a $3\times 3$ array thusly:

```
|-------|    |-------|    |-------|
|       |    |       |    |   |   |
|---O   |    |---O   |    |   O   |
|       |    |       |    |       |
|-------|    |-------|    |-------|
    A            B            C

|-------|    |-------|    |-------|
|       |    |       |    |       |
|   O   |    |   O   |    |   O   |
|   |   |    |   |   |    |   |   |
|-------|    |-------|    |-------|
    D            E            F

|-------|    |-------|    |-------|
|       |    |       |    |       |
|   O   |    |   O---|    |   O   |
|   |   |    |       |    |   |   |
|-------|    |-------|    |-------|
    G            H            I
```

The goal is to find a minimal sequence of moves to return all the dials to $12$ oâ€™clock. Nine different ways to turn the dials on the clocks are supplied via a table below; each way is called a move. Select for each move a number $1$ through $9$ which will cause the dials of the affected clocks (see next table) to be turned $90$ degrees clockwise.

Move | Affected clocks
--------|------------------
1| ABDE
2 |ABC
3| BCEF
4| ADG
5| BDEFH
6| CFI
7| DEGH
8| GHI
9| EFHI

#####Example
Each number represents a time accoring to following table:

```
9 9 12          9 12 12       9 12 12        12 12 12         12 12 12
6 6 6   5 ->    9  9  9   8-> 9  9  9   4 -> 12  9  9   9 ->  12 12 12
6 3 6           6  6  6       9  9  9        12  9  9         12 12 12
```

[But this might or might not be the `correct` answer; see below.]

statement.title: # Standard Input
statement.content: Lines $1-3$: Three lines of three space-separated numbers; each number represents the start time of one clock, $3$, $6$, $9$, or $12$. The ordering of the numbers corresponds to the first example above.

statement.title: # Standard Output
statement.content: A single line that contains a space separated list of the shortest sequence of moves (designated by numbers) which returns all the clocks to `12:00`. If there is more than one solution, print the one which gives the lowest number when the moves are concatenated (e.g., `5 2 4 6`$ < $`9 3 1 1`).

statement.title: # Samples
statement.content:
Input Output
9 9 12 6 6 6 6 3 64 5 8 9
